content.rendered:
Music lovers Linda and Danny first met at a concert in Washington D.C., and Danny later proposed while the pair were on vacation in Costa Rica.

We were thrilled to help them celebrate their marriage right here in Nashville with a rustic blue wedding with effortless natural touches at The Bell Tower.

The overall guest experience was most important to this sweet pair and having a relaxed, fun time topped the list. Pops of baby blue added a sweet spring touch with natural greenery and rustic wooden touches scattered throughout.

After the ceremony, cocktail hour kicked off on the patio. Light bites included coconut crusted shrimp, beef satay, southern chicken sliders and more.

For dinner, arugula salads began the meal. Entrees included marinated flank steak with haricot verts casserole and sage and white cheddar mashed potatoes. While those who opted for chicken enjoyed lemon and herb baked chicken with grilled asparagus and roasted corn and charred tomato risotto.

To wrap up the evening, the couple danced for the first time as newlyweds as guests looked on from the mezzanine with a mini donut or two in hand.

Keep scrolling to see more from this rustic blue wedding.

WEDDING DETAILS

Date: March 9, 2019
Bride & Groom: Linda & Danny
Location: The Bell Tower
Guest Count: 142
Colors: Dusty Blue, White, & Greenery
Photographer: Wind & Gold Photography
Florist: Forget Me Not Designs
Dessert: The Dapper Doughnut
Linens: Music City Tents
Band:  The Outliers
Catering & Bar: The Bell Tower
Production Design: Infinity Hospitality
Planning: Emily O. | IH

excerpt.rendered: A rustic, dusty blue wedding with natural touches at The Bell Tower.
